1103.name: Unknown
1103.message:
Unable to connect to the Wi-Fi network.

The security key you entered may not
be correct. 

Review the security settings for your
wireless router, and enter the security
key again. The Wii U security settings
can be found under the Internet option
in System Settings.

Make sure the Wii U console is within
range of your wireless router.

Move any electronics away from the
Wii U console and your wireless router. 

Try changing the wireless channel
within the settings of your wireless
router.

If you are unable to access or change
your wireless-router settings, please
contact the manufacturer for support.
1103.short_description: The Wi-Fi password has most likely been entered incorrectly.
1103.long_description: (CONNECTION SLOT 3) The Wi-Fi password has been entered incorrectly, the network has reached the maximum amount of devices connected at once, or the connection strength is poor.
1103.short_solution: Ensure that the correct password is being entered, power cycle the modem/router or try again later.
1103.long_solution: Ensure that the correct password is being entered, power cycle the modem/router or try again later. Also ensure that there arent too many devices connected at once and that there aren't any large objects containing metals or other electronic devices between the console and the router that could interfere with connection.
